user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_str_pct_decode_lenient_n_:
```c
size_t
MHD_str_pct_decode_lenient_n_ (const char *pct_encoded,
                               size_t pct_encoded_len,
                               char *decoded,
                               size_t buf_size,
                               bool *broken_encoding)
{
  size_t r;
  size_t w;
  r = 0;
  w = 0;
  if (NULL != broken_encoding)
    *broken_encoding = false;
#ifndef MHD_FAVOR_SMALL_CODE
  if (buf_size >= pct_encoded_len)
  {
    while (r < pct_encoded_len)
    {
      const char chr = pct_encoded[r];
      if ('%' == chr)
      {
        if (2 > pct_encoded_len - r)
        {
          if (NULL != broken_encoding)
            *broken_encoding = true;
          decoded[w] = chr; /* Copy "as is" */
        }
        else
        {
          const int h = toxdigitvalue (pct_encoded[++r]);
          const int l = toxdigitvalue (pct_encoded[++r]);
          unsigned char out;
          if ((0 > h) || (0 > l))
          {
            r -= 2;
            if (NULL != broken_encoding)
              *broken_encoding = true;
            decoded[w] = chr; /* Copy "as is" */
          }
          else
          {
            out =
              (unsigned char) (((uint8_t) (((uint8_t) ((unsigned int) h)) << 4))
                               | ((uint8_t) ((unsigned int) l)));
            decoded[w] = (char) out;
          }
        }
      }
      else
        decoded[w] = chr;
      ++r;
      ++w;
    }
    return w;
  }
#endif /* ! MHD_FAVOR_SMALL_CODE */
  while (r < pct_encoded_len)
  {
    const char chr = pct_encoded[r];
    if (w >= buf_size)
      return 0;
    if ('%' == chr)
    {
      if (2 > pct_encoded_len - r)
      {
        if (NULL != broken_encoding)
          *broken_encoding = true;
        decoded[w] = chr; /* Copy "as is" */
      }
      else
      {
        const int h = toxdigitvalue (pct_encoded[++r]);
        const int l = toxdigitvalue (pct_encoded[++r]);
        if ((0 > h) || (0 > l))
        {
          r -= 2;
          if (NULL != broken_encoding)
            *broken_encoding = true;
          decoded[w] = chr; /* Copy "as is" */
        }
        else
        {
          unsigned char out;
          out =
            (unsigned char) (((uint8_t) (((uint8_t) ((unsigned int) h)) << 4))
                             | ((uint8_t) ((unsigned int) l)));
          decoded[w] = (char) out;
        }
      }
    }
    else
      decoded[w] = chr;
    ++r;
    ++w;
  }
  return w;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: The two fragments above are the duplicated main decoding paths: the conditional block guarded by #ifndef MHD_FAVOR_SMALL_CODE (which contains an early return w) and the subsequent unguarded loop (which contains an early return 0 and a final return w). These should be investigated for possible unreachable code because (a) the entire #ifndef block may be excluded by the build (macro defined), and (b) when the #ifndef block is present and the runtime condition (buf_size >= pct_encoded_len) is true the later loop becomes unreachable in that execution path. Other parts of the function (initialization of r and w, the broken_encoding default assignment, the percent-decode inner statements where they occur, and the simple else branches and r/w increments) are straightforward, duplicated only as part of the two decoding paths above, and do not themselves present additional distinct unreachable-code concerns beyond the two flagged fragments.
